recordTypes.name: Business Tax Receipt
recordTypes.description: This is the link for any NEW business applications. If you have an existing business you want to make changes to, or close your business, please select the appropriate link.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Permit
recordTypes.description: Apply to hold a special event in the city limits of Stuart.

recordTypes.name: Banner Permit
recordTypes.description: Apply to place banners on City property.

recordTypes.name: Grease Discharge Certificate
recordTypes.description: Annual grease trap/interceptor inspection

recordTypes.name: Backflow Certificate of Completion
recordTypes.description: Backflow inspections are done annually. This is the link to register for your annual inspection.

recordTypes.name: False Alarm Responses
recordTypes.description: Form for recording false alarm responses, to the point of excessive.

recordTypes.name: Change of Use/Occupancy Permit
recordTypes.description: A Change or Use or Occupancy Permit is necessary when a building's use or occupancy classification is altered. This can include various scenarios, such as converting a residential property into a commercial space or changing the type of business operating within a building. The Florida Building Code mandates that any change in occupancy must comply with the current edition of the Florida Building Code (FBC) and Zoning Regulations.

recordTypes.name: Business Tax Receipt - Out of State Insurance Companies
recordTypes.description: This is the link for Out of State Insurance Companies ONLY. If you have an existing business you want to make changes to, or close your business, please select the appropriate link.

recordTypes.name: Land Development Code Text Amendment (LDC) Applicaiton
recordTypes.description: A proposal to amend the text of the LDC, including changes to the actual list of permitted, conditional or prohibited uses within a zoning category may be initiated by the city of by the owner of land affected by the proposed amendment.

recordTypes.name: Lien Search Request
recordTypes.description: The lien search will be conducted with the specific owner(s) name and property address that you provided.

recordTypes.name: Stuart Fire Safety Inspection
recordTypes.description: Application for Fire Inspections including, but not limited to, Foster Care, Group Home, Daycare, Assisted Living, Residential Care, and ABC Permit.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Inspections
recordTypes.description: Inspections related to special events such as tents, fire department access and lifesafety.

recordTypes.name: Minor Development Site Plan
recordTypes.description:
A minor development plan is one which is:
1. A single-family, multi-family or duplex residential project of between three and 35 units, inclusive.
2. A non-residential development under 50,000 square feet in area.
3. A mixed-use development under 50,000 square feet in area.
4. A public or private institutional development less than one acre in land area.
5. Commercial tenant finishes (i.e. interior/exterior tenant buildout improvements)
6. Right-of-way dedication.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration
recordTypes.description:
IMPORTANT LICENSING UPDATE - EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2025
Effective July 1, 2025, the City of Stuart will no longer accept Certificate of Competency as a valid form of licensure for contractors.  Under Florida Statute 489.117, all contractors (as defined in FS 489.105(3)(a)-(o) must be State Registered or State Certified to operate legally in Florida.
If you're currently using Certificate of Competency issued by Martin County to perform/contract work, you will need to take action to comply with state requirements.

recordTypes.name: Business - Closing Request
recordTypes.description: This is the link to CLOSE an existing business.

recordTypes.name: Major Development Site Plan
recordTypes.description:
A minor development plan is one which is:
1. A single-family, multi-family or duplex residential project of between three and 35 units, inclusive.
2. A non-residential development under 50,000 square feet in area.
3. A mixed-use development under 50,000 square feet in area.
4. A public or private institutional development less than one acre in land area.
5. Commercial tenant finishes (i.e. interior/exterior tenant buildout improvements)
6. Right-of-way dedication.

recordTypes.name: Annexation Application
recordTypes.description: Refer to the City's Land Development Code Section 11.01.12. and must be consistent with F.S. ch. 171

recordTypes.name: Historical Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Owner/Builders & Contractors - please choose this option

recordTypes.name: Major Urban Code Conditional Use Application
recordTypes.description: Major Urban Code conditional use shall be required for relief from the following regulations of the Urban Code; density, permitted uses, setbacks, location of parking, location of buildings and structures, conflicts with utilities, curb cuts, historic buildings, pitched roofs in the Old Downtown District, number of stories, building height not to exceed 45 feet, parking located within a building envelope, location of a formula business, and architectural requirements.

recordTypes.name: East Stuart Code Conditional Use Application
recordTypes.description: A major conditional use approval is a specific authorization granted by the city commission to permit certain uses of property, which are unique due to the nature of the use, size, location, or various characteristics particular to the zoning district. The issuance of a major conditional use approval is required for the use or occupancy of a structure specifically designated as a conditional use in the "zone district" chapter of this Code and is subject to the limitations and conditions specified therein. A major conditional use approval application may not be filed if the city commission has denied an application for a conditional use for the subject property within the previous two years.

recordTypes.name: Mural Minor Conditional Use Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Major Urban Code conditional use shall be required for relief from the following regulations of the Urban Code; density, permitted uses, setbacks, location of parking, location of buildings and structures, conflicts with utilities, curb cuts, historic buildings, pitched roofs in the Old Downtown District, number of stories, building height not to exceed 45 feet, parking located within a building envelope, location of a formula business, and architectural requirements.

recordTypes.name: Major Planned Unit Development Amendment Applicaiton
recordTypes.description: Major Planned Unit Development Amendment - Any major amendment to a previously adopted planned unit development zoning ordinance, including conditions, agreements, covenants, maps, and illustrations shall be processed as if the proposed amendment is a new rezoning application.

recordTypes.name: Rezone to Urban Planned Unit Development (UPUD) Application
recordTypes.description: LDC Section 11.01.09. Rezoning map change application including Planned Unit Development (PUD)

recordTypes.name: Rezone to Commercial Planned Unit Development (CPUD) Application
recordTypes.description: LDC Section 11.01.09. Rezoning map change application including Planned Unit Development (PUD)

recordTypes.name: Rezone to Industrial Planned Unit Development (IPUD) Application
recordTypes.description: LDC Section 2.07.00.G. Industrial Planned Unit Development (IPUD) A IPUD may be located anywhere in the city where the area is defined and described "industrial" or "marine/industrial" by the future land use element of the City of Stuart's comprehensive plan and which is of suitable character and compatible with surrounding uses as determined by the city commission.

recordTypes.name: Small-Scale Comprehensive Plan Amendment Application
recordTypes.description: LDC Section 11.01.07. "Small-scale" Comprehensive Plan Amendment.

recordTypes.name: 1-COP/2-COP Admin Conditional Zoning Application
recordTypes.description: A zoning approval for a 1-COP or 2-COP alcoholic beverage license in the Old Downtown District per Code of Ordinance, Section 4-3.

recordTypes.name: Plat Application
recordTypes.description: Plat or Replat means a map or delineated representation of the subdivision of lands, being a complete exact representation of the subdivision and other information in compliance with the requirement of Chapter 177 of the Florida Statutes and of any local ordinances.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Determination Letter Application
recordTypes.description: A Zoning Determination Letter is a drafted by the Planning/Zoning Planning Department confirming the zoning designation within the city limits. This type of letter is useful when trying to ascertain what uses can be placed on a property as well as the property's setbacks, height limitations, density, minimum lot sizes and other related information.

recordTypes.name: Pre-Application Meeting Request
recordTypes.description:
A pre-application meeting is mandatory for all applicants intending to submit a development proposal. It is a forum in which the applicant and the review staff can discuss issues related to the project concept.

The purpose of the application should be to communicate to the reviewing staff, the decision-makers, and the public what is being proposed and how the proposal meets and complies with the Cityâ€™s Comprehensive Plan and the Land Development Code.

recordTypes.name: Executive Development Order - State of Emergency
recordTypes.description: The declaration of a state of emergency issued by the Governor for a natural emergency tolls the period remaining to exercise the rights under a permit or other authorization for the duration of the emergency declaration. Further, the emergency declaration extends the period remaining to exercise the rights under a permit or other authorization for 24 months in addition to the tolled period.
